# touchesBegan(with:)

**Instance Method**

Called when one or more fingers first make contact with an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar] instance on the Touch Bar.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func touchesBegan(with event: NSEvent)
```

## Instance Methods

- **touchesCancelled(with:)**: Called when a system event, such as a low-memory warning, cancels an in-progress touch event in an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar] object.
- **touchesEnded(with:)**: Called when one or more fingers are removed from contact with an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar] instance on the Touch Bar.
- **touchesMoved(with:)**: Called when one or more fingers, associated with an in-progress event, move within an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar] instance on the Touch Bar.
